acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in transfers of court papers from Alleghany County Circuit Court under the accession numbers 36754, 36755 and 36756.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Alleghany County was named for the Allegheny Mountains, although it has a variant spelling. It was formed from Bath, Botetourt, and Monroe (West Virginia) Counties in 1822, and additional parts of Bath (1823) and Monroe (1843) were added. The former independent city of Clifton Forge reverted to the county in 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Alleghany County (Va.) Miscellaneous Records, 1883-1961, consist of Contracts for Personal Property (conditional sales contracts), Miscellaneous Liens, Mechanics' Liens, and Federal Farm Credit Liens.
